historySnippet.reasoning: A is already safely above 0.75 but is slightly fading (dA/dt=-0.0004), so to stabilize near-peak agency without disrupting the best-known regime (U=0.10), I’ll keep U fixed and reduce k_A_decay slightly (a lever that previously improved A at Gen 3933.8 and 4140.0).

Agency is already safely above 0.75 and still rising (dA/dt=0.0051) while C is slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the best-record level (0.10) and nudge complexity support by slightly reducing k_C_decay (which historically improved A at Gen 4104/4250) without perturbing diversity pressure (k_DU stays 0).

Agency is already at the ceiling (A=1.0) but dA/dt is slightly negative; to arrest the fade without risking a diversity crash (D≈1.0, k_DU already 0), keep U at the proven best (0.10) and slightly reduce k_A_decay (prior k_A_decay tweaks had large impact, incl. a big drop at Gen 4281.0), while leaving diversity/complexity drivers unchanged.

Agency is already at 1.0 but dA/dt is slightly negative, so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) and counter the fade by reducing k_A_decay further (prior k_A_decay tweaks sometimes hurt, so keep the change minimal) while preserving high C and D.

Agency is already above target and still rising with U matching the best record (0.10), so I’ll keep U steady and make a small, low-risk revert toward the best-known stable decay settings to reduce alert-driven instability while preserving near-saturation A (noting past k_A_decay tweaks sometimes caused drops).

A is still very high but fading while D is collapsing (dD/dt < 0), so I’ll keep U at the best-record level and apply a small “diversity stabilization” phase shift by reducing k_D_decay (and slightly lowering k_C_decay) since past k_C_decay tweaks improved A and we don’t want D to erode and later drag C/A down.

historySnippet.action: Updated Params: k_CD, k_AC, k_DU, k_C_decay, k_D_decay, k_A_decay
historySnippet.reasoning: Agency is already far above the 0.75 objective but is slowly fading (dA/dt=-0.0019), and since recent k_A_decay tweaks often hurt A (e.g., Gen 4281/4385/4419) while the best record used slightly lower k_AC/k_CD and a small nonzero k_DU, I’ll revert toward that stable best basin and slightly reduce decay to arrest the drift without sacrificing C/D.

A is still very high but fading while D is collapsing, so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) and reduce diversity loss by lowering k_D_decay (since recent k_A_decay tweaks tended to hurt A and D is the immediate risk).

A is already far above the 0.75 objective but is fading while D is collapsing; since the best record was achieved at U=0.10 with near-identical params and recent k_A_decay tweaks tended to hurt (e.g., Gen 4281/4385/4419), we keep U at the proven level and reduce diversity-collapse pressure by lowering k_D_decay while leaving k_DU unchanged per rule 3.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising, but Diversity is starting to collapse (dD/dt=-0.0122), so keep U at the best-record level while easing diversity decay pressure by lowering k_D_decay (recent small k_D_decay tweaks slightly improved A) and minimally reducing k_DU to preserve exploration without destabilizing A.

name: Low-U Agency Weaver
description: This agent emerged in a low-difficulty niche (U=0.10) by tightly coupling complexity and diversity into agency (k_AC=0.49, k_CD=0.46) while keeping stochastic drift minimal (sigma_A=0.005, sigma_C=0.005). Its lineage shows repeated sensitivity to agency decay—multiple k_A_decay increases caused drops—followed by recovery when decay pressures were rebalanced (k_C_decay and k_D_decay adjustments), culminating in a stable, high-agency attractor (A=0.994) without any validation violations.
